publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-5604 Dennis Canavan: International Workers’ Memorial Day—That the Parliament recognises International Workers’ Memorial Day on 28 April and urges widespread recognition of it throughout Scotland to commemorate all the workers who have lost their lives in the course of their employment and to highlight the need to improve standards of health and safety at work. Supported by: Tommy Sheridan*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Rosie Kane*, Frances Curran*, Campbell Martin*, Mr Jamie Stone*, Robin Harper*, Dr Elaine Murray*, Mark Ballard*, Cathy Peattie*, Jackie Baillie*, Shona Robison*, Bill Butler*, Phil Gallie*, Rob Gibson*, Donald Gorrie*, Elaine Smith*

S2M-5604 International Workers’ Memorial Day (lodged on 19 February 2007) Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Cathie Craigie*, Karen Gillon*, Bristow Muldoon*, John Swinburne*, Malcolm Chisholm*, Scott Barrie*, Eleanor Scott*, Colin Fox*, Michael Matheson*

S2M-5604*#* Dennis Canavan: International Workers’ Memorial Day—That the Parliament recognises International Workers’ Memorial Day on 28 April and *believes that there should be* widespread recognition of it throughout Scotland to commemorate all the workers who have lost their lives in the course of their employment and to highlight the need to improve standards of health and safety at work. Supported by: Dr Jean Turner*
S2M-5604# International Workers’ Memorial Day (lodged on 19 February 2007) Michael McMahon*, Trish Godman*, Carolyn Leckie*

S2M-5604# Dennis Canavan: International Workers’ Memorial Day—That the Parliament recognises International Workers’ Memorial Day on 28 April and believes that there should be widespread recognition of it throughout Scotland to commemorate all the workers who have lost their lives in the course of their employment and to highlight the need to improve standards of health and safety at work. Supported by: Tommy Sheridan, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Rosie Kane, Frances Curran, Campbell Martin, Mr Jamie Stone, Robin Harper, Dr Elaine Murray, Mark Ballard, Cathy Peattie, Jackie Baillie, Shona Robison, Bill Butler, Phil Gallie, Rob Gibson, Donald Gorrie, Elaine Smith, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Cathie Craigie, Karen Gillon, Bristow Muldoon, John Swinburne, Malcolm Chisholm, Scott Barrie, Eleanor Scott, Colin Fox, Michael Matheson, Dr Jean Turner, Michael McMahon, Trish Godman, Carolyn Leckie
S2M-5604# International Workers’ Memorial Day (lodged on 19 February 2007) Marlyn Glen*
S2M-5604# International Workers’ Memorial Day (lodged on 19 February 2007) Chris Ballance*
S2M-5604# International Workers’ Memorial Day (lodged on 19 February 2007) Linda Fabiani*
S2M-5604# International Workers’ Memorial Day (lodged on 19 February 2007) Susan Deacon*

S2M-5604# Dennis Canavan: International Workers’ Memorial Day—That the Parliament recognises International Workers’ Memorial Day on 28 April and believes that there should be widespread recognition of it throughout Scotland to commemorate all the workers who have lost their lives in the course of their employment and to highlight the need to improve standards of health and safety at work. Supported by: Tommy Sheridan, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Rosie Kane, Frances Curran, Campbell Martin, Mr Jamie Stone, Robin Harper, Dr Elaine Murray, Mark Ballard, Cathy Peattie, Jackie Baillie, Shona Robison, Bill Butler, Phil Gallie, Rob Gibson, Donald Gorrie, Elaine Smith, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Cathie Craigie, Karen Gillon, Bristow Muldoon, John Swinburne, Malcolm Chisholm, Scott Barrie, Eleanor Scott, Colin Fox, Michael Matheson, Dr Jean Turner, Michael McMahon, Trish Godman, Carolyn Leckie, Marlyn Glen, Chris Ballance, Linda Fabiani, Susan Deacon
